Mountain trolls are aggressive creatures which can be found patrolling various mountainous areas.

They are commonly killed as part of an assigned Slayer task of "Trolls".

Trolls regenerate health quickly but are still vulnerable to poison. They usually use crush weapons, which, combined with their relatively high Strength, can hit rather hard. However, they attack slowly and are quite inaccurate, so it's not strictly necessary to use protection prayers for players that have high Defence. A good strategy for conserving supplies is to use Bones to Peaches on the Big bones that they drop; this will almost always cover any damage they manage to deal. Bringing a Staff of Fire (or similar item) and Nature runes is recommended in order to alchemise their frequent low-level armour and weapon drops.

On Death Plateau, they can be safespotted from many areas; all of the stone fences and pretty much every other obstacle in the area can be shot over with ranged or magic. Stick and Rock count as mountain trolls and can easily be safespotted using the stone fence on the west side of the plateau for additional Slayer XP (beware that these two hit much harder and more often than standard mountain trolls). Alternatively, they can be safespotted around the corners of some rock piles in the Keldagrim entrance area.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

The average Mountain troll kill is worth 987.72.

The average Mountain troll kill while on a Konar task is worth 1,376.02.
